results.title: Pierre et Paul = Pierre and Paul
results.creator_credit: Rene Allio, Yves Robert and Leon Carre
results.brief_description:
Pierre, a middle manager in a building company, decides to buy a appartment and live with his girlfriend, Martine. But, the subsequent death of his father and various financial difficulties soon damage his mental equilibrium. When the May ‘68 riots errupt, Pierre goes off the rails.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre, Yves Robert ; director, Rene Allio ; writer, Rene Allio ; photography, Georges Leclerc ; music, Jacques Dutronc.
Cast: Pierre Mondy, Robert Juillard, Bulle Ogier, Madeleine Barbulee, Helene Vincent.

results.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (Director's cut) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Patricia Lovell, Jim McElroy, Hal McElroy and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1900 three girls from a private school and their teacher unaccountably vanish on a St Valentine’s Day school picnic to a mysterious rock in the midst of the Australian bush. The Victorian girls’ school for the daughters of the privileged gradually becomes contaminated and destroyed from within by its inability to understand the forces confronting it. Based on a novel which mythologises the emergence of sexuality, the film atmospherically follows various tangents without distilling a sense of explanation. Unease is evoked by the horror of not knowing. Based on the novel by Joan Lindsay. Cast includes Rachel Roberts, Dominic Guard, Helen Morse and Jacki Weaver. This special 25th anniversary edition is a widescreen, restored director’s cut version containing 7 minutes less footage than original version.

results.title: Picnic
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Fred Kohlmar and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on William Inge’s Pulitzer Prize winning Broadway hit, “Picnic” is a revealing look into the hearts and minds of a select group of Kansas townfolk over Labor Day weekend. This simple yet poignant story stars William Holden as an itinerant drifter who swings into town, stirring up trouble and awakening the interest of Kim Novak. At first, Holden refused the role - considering himself too old for the part at 37. However, his outstanding performance proved critical to the film’s success, and his love scenes with Novak are considered to be among the most sensual in cinema history. Co-starring Susan Strasberg, Rosalind Russell and Cliff Robertson, “Picnic” was nominated for several and also won two Academy Awards.

results.title: Pick up your feet: the double dutch show
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A powerful examination of the determined spirits who compete in the Double Dutch rope-jumping championships in New York City. In this raw work, both the camera and the microphone have the incidental presence of a trusted insider. Moving between the training and the competition, Blumberg manages to capture the excitement of the crowd, as young athletes drive themselves and their partners to the edge of the possible. The rhythmic beat of the ropes, the chants, and the strain of concentration, taps into an unexpected well of emotion through which we seem to be almost participants in the event itself.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 23-24
results.creator_credit: Kate Woods, Julian McSwiney, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Phoenix”.
Shuffling Deck’: Now that the case has intensified from aggravated burglary to drug importation, the Federal Police are brought in and want to take over the investigation. There is no way the Majors will allow this to happen, so they decide to work together as a joint task force to try and catch the crooks. Ian and the forensics team has a breakthrough in the identity of Betty’s rapist with the discovery of very high lead levels in his blood.Under Siege’: Victor Flannagan is seen at a market talking to another character whom the Majors follow. He turns out to be Gary McKinnon and the Majors think he may be one of the burglars. They keep a trace on Gary’s flat and end up with enough evidence for a raid. It eventuates that Gary’s flat is rented out under the same name of the stolen Medicare card that was used to sell James Arthur’s Rolex to the pawn shop. The raid does not go well; firstly, they have trouble breaking the door down, then they lose Gary who escapes out a window, his terrified girlfriend also jumps out of a window and may never walk again. All the squad members are interviewed over the ensuing investigation into whether someone pushed her, which brings bad light on the Major crime Squad, again. Peter tracks Gary down to his ex-girlfriends house where he is taken hostage in a very violent situation.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 17-18
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Mark Callan, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Phoenix”.
The Return’: A second attack is carried out against the Arthur’s but this time Betty is viciously raped and James beaten severely, all for the sake of 6 stamps. There is a new addition to the major’s with the addition of Russell Howie from Fraud and he fits in well. It appears the Arthur’s knew their assailant as there was no forced entry or alarm activated. Could it be they tricked the Arthur’s by saying it was one of the Major Squad members at the door?Inside Information’: Murdoch gets a tip off about a possible location for a warehouse where the stolen goods from the burglaries are and organises a warrant to raid the factory. Here they encounter Lindy (Nadine Garner), who screams sexual assault against Howie for ripping her clothes off while he tries to detain her. James Arthur is so scared from the attacks on him and Betty that he’s turned his house into a fortress. Peter goes looking for Joe who receives stolen paintings and rare art and could know the identity of the burglars. Unfortunately Peter is overheard making a deal which makes him a target of Internal affairs. James Arthur is found dead in his home in a poor attempt at revenge.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Carson, Mark Callan, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
